comments.creator: gobzo@aim.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101209 Fedora/3.6.13-1.fc14 Firefox 3.6.3 (.NET CLR 3.5.30729)
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101209 Fedora/3.6.13-1.fc14 Firefox 3.6.3 (.NET CLR 3.5.30729)

When FF autostarts, I have to close it down and open again in order to get the list of recently used sites drop down from the address bar.
Also when it happens typing in the address bar does not bring any remembered sites from history.

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start FF in KDE
2. Log off/shutdown/reboot with session set to restore
3. When FF started automatically after reboot described defect occurs 50% of the time.

comments.raw_text: Can you please update to Firefox 3.6.13 or later, and use an official mozilla.org build, not the distro one, then test again.

As to using your distro this environment only uses f14 repository.

comments.author: gobzo@aim.com

comments.text:
This is bigger than I thought.
None of the drop down boxes work when this happens, including the web page forms.
I built a test machine and used your build and it still has the same issue.

comments.author: gobzo@aim.com
comments.creator: gobzo@aim.com
comments.text:
I don't understand why you can't fix this bug.
Not everyone is eager to upgrade a perfect working system.
Needless to say that 4.0.1 does not even compile.
comments.raw_text:
I don't understand why you can't fix this bug.

comments.author: tdowner@mozilla.com
comments.creator: tdowner@mozilla.com
comments.text: If you aren't willing to upgrade it is kinda silly to think we can fix the bug. It's impossible to release a fix without an upgrade. Have you tried creating a fresh profile?
comments.raw_text: If you aren't willing to upgrade it is kinda silly to think we can fix the bug. It's impossible to release a fix without an upgrade. Have you tried creating a fresh profile?

comments.author: gobzo@aim.com
comments.creator: gobzo@aim.com
comments.text:
No, it's not impossible to fix previous version. That should be obvious for developers.

New profile is irrelevant as this bug exists in the brand new installs.
comments.raw_text:
No, it's not impossible to fix previous version. That should be obvious for developers.

New profile is irrelevant as this bug exists in the brand new installs.

comments.creator: tdowner@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text: No, Mozilla policy is that old version only receive stability (ie. crashers) and security fixes.
comments.text: No, Mozilla policy is that old version only receive stability (ie. crashers) and security fixes.
